name: Earthbind
desc: The weight of earth is hampering your flight, with effects based on your Fortitude save. If you reach the ground safely, you don't take falling damage. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You fall safely up to 120 feet. Failure You fall safely up to 120 feet. If you hit the ground, you can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 round. Critical Failure You fall safely up to 120 feet. If you hit the ground, you can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 minute.

hints.desc: If you hit the ground after your fall, you can't Fly, levitate or otherwise leave the ground.

name: Earthbind (Caster)
desc: Using the weight of earth, you are hampering a target's flight, with effects based on its Fortitude save. If the creature reaches the ground safely, it doesn't take falling damage. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target falls safely up to 120 feet. Failure The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 round. Critical Failure The target falls safely up to 120 feet. If it hits the ground, it can't Fly, levitate, or otherwise leave the ground for 1 minute.

name: Earthquake
desc: The ground shakes, creatures are toppled into fissures, and structures collapse in the target area. The GM might add additional effects in certain areas. Cliffs might collapse, causing creatures to fall, or a lake might drain as fissures open up below its surface, leaving a morass of quicksand. Shaking Ground The ground is difficult terrain, and creatures on it take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC, and skill checks. Fissures Each creature on the ground must attempt a Reflex save at the start of its turn to keep its footing and avoid falling into 40-foot-deep fissures that open beneath it. The fissures are permanent, and their sides require DC 15 Athletics to Climb. Collapse Structures and ceilings might collapse. The GM rolls a flat check for each (DC 16 for a sturdy structure, DC 14 for an average structure and most natural formations, DC 9 for a shoddy structure, all adjusted higher or lower as the GM sees fit). A collapse deals 11d6 bludgeoning damage; each creature caught in a collapse must attempt a Reflex save to avoid it. Critical Success The creature takes half the collapse damage. Success The creature takes half the collapse damage and falls prone. Failure The creature takes the full collapse damage and falls prone. Critical Failure The creature takes the full collapse damage and falls into a fissure.

hints.desc: You take a -2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls, AC and skill checks while on shaking ground.
The shaking ground is difficult terrain.

descs.value: You create a massive earthquake that can devastate a settlement. The range increases to half a mile and the area to a quarter-mile burst.

name: Ectoplasmic Interstice (Caster)
desc: You have forced the Material and Ethereal Planes to partially overlap, creating a zone that causes incorporeal and spiritual entities to take on many of the aspects of corporeal creatures. Within the ectoplasmic interstice, incorporeal creatures cannot pass through solid objects or corporeal creatures, and they can manipulate and attempt Strength-based checks against physical creatures and objects. An incorporeal PC or other creature with a normal Strength modifier simply uses that modifier, but if the creature had a Strength modifier of -5, like most incorporeal monsters, it uses a +4 modifier instead, increasing its Athletics modifier by 9 accordingly. Attacks against creatures that are within the interstice overcome resistances as if they were by ghost touch weapons.

hints.desc: Attacks against creatures that are within the interstice overcome resistances as if they were by ghost touch weapons.

Attacks against creatures that are within the interstice overcome resistances as if they were by ghost touch weapons.

name: Eject Soul
desc: The connection between your body and soul has been disrupted, possibly forcing your soul out of your body altogether. You are affected according to your Fortitude save. If you are an ally of the caster, they can allow you to choose the degree of success instead of rolling a saving throw. Success You are unaffected. Failure You are stunned 1 as your soul briefly loses its connection to your body. Critical Failure Your soul exits its body for 1 round. var1Your body becomes stunned. While your body is stunned in this way, you remain fully aware in soul form; you simply can't consciously move your body (though the body makes basic instinctual defensive movements). Your soul has the incorporeal trait, is invisible, and has a fly Speed of 60 feet. You can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body, and you must always maintain line of effect to your body. When your body ceases being stunned, your soul instantly returns to your body as you wake.

hints.desc: You can't consciously move your body (though the body makes basic instinctual defensive movements). You can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body, and you must always maintain line of effect to your body.

name: Elemental Form
desc: You have transformed into a var_size elemental battle form. When you cast this spell, choose air, earth, fire, or water. While in this form, you gain the corresponding trait and the elemental trait. You have hands in this battle form and can take manipulate actions. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of which battle form you choose: AC = var_ac + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction. var_temphp temporary Hit Points. Darkvision. One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form you choose, which are the only attacks you can use. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is var_attack, and your damage bonus is var_dmgbonus. These are Dexterity based (air or fire) or Strength based (earth or water). If your corresponding unarmed attack modifier is higher, you can use it instead. Acrobatics (air or fire) or Athletics (earth or water) modifier of var_athletics; ignore this change if your own modifier is higher. You also gain specific abilities based on the form you choose: Air fly Speed 80 feet, movement doesn't trigger reactions; Melee gustvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice1d4 bludgeoning. Earth Speed 20 feet, burrow Speed 20 feet; Melee fistvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice2d10 bludgeoning. Fire Speed 50 feet; fire resistance 10, weakness 5 to cold and 5 to water; Melee tendrilvar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice1d8 fire plus var_dice1d4 persistent fire. Water Speed 20 feet, swim Speed 60 feet; fire resistance 5; Melee wavevar_noreachnotraits, Damage var_dice1d12 bludgeoning, and you can spend an action immediately after a hit to push the target 5 feet with the effects of a successful Shove.

name: Dust Storm
desc: You have called forth a swirling storm of dust. The dust storm obscures vision, with the effect of obscuring mist. The dust also makes the air unbreathable; creatures in the area must hold their breath, though wearing a scarf or similar clothing over the mouth increases the time the creature can hold its breath to 5 rounds. Creatures entering or starting their turn in the dust storm take |dice=var1 S| <var>var1</var> slashing damage. Creatures that have the water trait or that are made primarily of liquid take double damage.

name: Drop Dead (Caster)
desc: The target appears to have fallen down dead, though it has actually turned invisible. Its illusory corpse remains where it fell, complete with a believable fatal wound. This illusion looks and feels like a dead body. If the target's death seems absurd - for instance, a barbarian at full health appears to be slain by 2 damage - the GM can grant the attacker an immediate Perception check to disbelieve the illusion. <var>var1</var>

name: Dreaming Potential (Caster)
desc: You draw the target into a lucid dream where it can explore the endless possibilities of its own potential within the ever-changing backdrop of its dreamscape. If it sleeps the full 8 hours uninterrupted, when it wakes, it counts as having spent a day of downtime retraining, though it can't use dreaming potential for any retraining that would require either an instructor or specialized knowledge it can't access within the dream.

name: Diviner's Sight (Caster)
desc: You have glimpsed into a chosen target's future and rolled a d20. When the target attempts a non-secret saving throw or skill check, it can use the number you rolled instead of rolling, and the spell ends. Alternatively, you can instead reveal the result of the die roll for one of the target's secret checks during the duration, and the spell ends. Casting it again ends any active diviner's sight you have cast, as well as any active diviner's sight on the target.

name: Dominate
desc: The caster has taken command of you, forcing you to obey their orders. If they issue an obviously self-destructive order, you don't act until they issue a new order. The effect depends on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You are stunned 1 as you fight off the caster's commands. Failure The caster controls you. You gain the controlled condition, but you can attempt a Will save at the end of each of your turns. On a success, the spell ends. Critical Failure As a failure, but you receive a new save only if the caster gives you a new order that is against your nature, such as killing your allies.
inputRequired:
On a failure, you receive a new Will save at the end of each of your turns. On a success, the spell ends and you can remove the condition.

Critical Failure As a failure, but the target receives a new save only if you give it a new order that is against its nature, such as killing its allies.

name: Door to Beyond
desc: Striking at thin air, you have created hairline cracks in an unoccupied adjacent space that lead somewhere outside reality. Air rushes through the cracks, drawing Large or smaller creatures and objects of light Bulk or less toward the center. Large or smaller creatures in the area must attempt a Fortitude save at the start of their turn; creatures that move into the area must attempt the save on entering. Success The creature is unaffected. Failure The creature is pulled 10 feet toward the door. Critical Failure The creature is pulled 20 feet toward the door. The cracks of the door to beyond are too thin for anything to fully slip through, but decompressive effects deal |dice=var1 S| var1 slashing damage to any creature or object that ends its turn in the door's space. You are unaffected by your own door to beyond. You can Dismiss the spell.

name: Downpour
desc: The caster has called forth a torrential downpour, which extinguishes nonmagical flames. While you are in the area, you are concealed and gain fire resistance <var>var1</var>. Creatures outside the area are concealed to those inside the area. Creatures with weakness to water that end their turns in the area take damage equal to their weakness.

While the spell persists, you can command one of your dragons to spit a missile of energy at a creature within 60 feet by using a single action, which has the concentrate trait. This is a ranged Strike that uses your spell attack bonus and deals |dice=var2 + spellMod| var2 damage plus your spellcasting ability modifier, with the damage type depending on the dragon. A dragon's breath Strike uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty. Once a dragon has used its breath Strike, it winks out of existence; when you have no dragons remaining, the spell ends. 1 Copper or black dragon, Acid breath 2 Silver or white dragon, Cold breath 3 Bronze or blue dragon, Electricity breath 4 Brass, gold, or red dragon, Fire breath 5 Green Dragon, Poison breath 6 Your choice of dragon, breath type as the dragon

name: Enduring Might
desc: Your own might mingles with divine power to protect you. You gain resistance equal to <var>var1</var> plus your Strength modifier against all damage from the triggering attack or effect.

name: Dragon Claws
desc: Vicious claws have grown from your fingers. They are finesse unarmed attacks that deal 1d4 slashing damage and var1 extra damage of a type determined by the dragon in your bloodline. Black and copper Acid Blue and bronze Electricity Brass, gold, or red Fire Green Poison Silver or white Cold Your scales from blood magic glow with faint energy, giving you resistance var2 to the same damage type.

name: Dragon Wings
desc: Leathery wings have sprouted from your back, giving you a fly Speed of 60 feet or your Speed, whichever is faster. When this spell's duration would end, if you're still flying, you float to the ground, as feather fall.

name: Drain Life
desc: You have pulled life energy from another creature into yourself. You gain temporary Hit Points equal to the damage you dealt, after resolving its save and applying your blood magic if applicable. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage you dealt, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead. The temporary Hit Points last for the duration of the condition.
inputRequired: Manually set the appropriate amount of temporary Hit Points. When the condition ends, all manually added Hit Points will be lost.

name: Dread Aura
desc: You emit an aura of terror with a 30-foot radius. Foes in the area are frightened 1 and unable to reduce the condition.

name: Dream Message
desc: You have sent a message to your target's dream, or the same message to multiple targets' dreams. If a target is asleep, they receive the message instantly. If not, they receive it the next time they sleep. As soon as they receive it, the spell ends, and you know the message was sent.
inputRequired: Remove the condition when the target has received the message.

name: Dreamer's Call
desc: You become distracted and suggestible, inundated by vivid daydreams. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success Your attention wavers. You become flat-footed and fascinated by your daydreams. Failure As success, except that the caster appears in the dream and gives a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action as your first action after you Cast the Spell. Critical Failure As failure, but you must follow the course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and do nothing else.

hints.desc: The caster has appeared in your dream and given a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action as your first action after the Spell was Cast.

The caster has appeared in your dream and given a suggestion. This can be to approach them, run away (as if you had the fleeing condition), Release what you're holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. You must follow this course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and do nothing else.

name: Dreamer's Call (Caster)
desc: The target becomes distracted and suggestible, inundated by vivid daydreams. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target's attention wavers. It becomes flat-footed and fascinated by its daydreams. Failure As success, except that you appear in the dream and give a suggestion. This can be to approach you, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), Release what it's holding, Drop Prone, or stand in place. The creature follows this course of action as its first action after you Cast the Spell. Critical Failure As failure, but the target follows the course of action for as many actions as possible for the spell's duration, and it does nothing else.

name: Dreaming Potential
desc: You have been drawn into a lucid dream where you can explore the endless possibilities of your own potential within the ever-changing backdrop of your dreamscape. If you sleep the full 8 hours uninterrupted, when you wake, it counts as having spent a day of downtime retraining, though you can't use dreaming potential for any retraining that would require either an instructor or specialized knowledge you can't access within the dream.

name: Dragon Form
desc: You have transformed into a var_size dragon battle form. When you cast this spell, choose one type of chromatic or metallic dragon. While in this form, you gain the dragon trait. You have hands in this battle form and can take manipulate actions. You can Dismiss the spell. You gain the following statistics and abilities regardless of which battle form you choose: AC = var_ac + your level. Ignore your armor's check penalty and Speed reduction. var_temphp temporary Hit Points. Speed 40 feet, fly Speed 100 feet. Resistance 10 against the damage type of your breath weapon (see below). Darkvision and imprecise scent 60 feet. One or more unarmed melee attacks specific to the battle form you choose, which are the only attacks you can use. You're trained with them. Your attack modifier is var_attack, and your damage bonus is var_dmgbonus. These attacks are Strength based (for the purpose of the enfeebled condition, for example). If your unarmed attack modifier is higher, you can use it instead. See below for more on these attacks. Athletics modifier of var_athletics, unless your own modifier is higher. Breath Weapon (arcane, evocation) The shape, damage, and damage type of your breath weapon depend on your specific dragon form (see below). A creature in the area attempts a basic save against your spell DC. This is a Reflex save unless stated otherwise in the special ability description for your specific dragon form. Once activated, your breath weapon can't be used again for 1d4 rounds. Your breath weapon has the trait corresponding to the type of damage it deals.var_breathbonus You also gain specific abilities based on the type of dragon you choose: Black swim Speed 60 feet; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 acid; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee horns (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 piercing; breath weapon 60-foot line, 11d6 acid. Blue burrow Speed 20 feet; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d10 piercing plus 1d12 electricity; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee horns (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 piercing; breath weapon 80-foot line, 6d12 electricity. Brass burrow Speed 20 feet; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 3d8 piercing plus 2d4 fire; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee spikes (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 piercing; breath weapon 60-foot line, 15d4 fire. Bronze swim Speed 40 feet; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d10 piercing plus 1d12 electricity; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee wing (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 slashing; breath weapon 80-foot line, 6d12 electricity. Copper climb Speed 25 feet on stone only; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 acid; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee wing (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 bludgeoning; breath weapon 60-foot line, 10d6 acid. Gold swim Speed 40 feet; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 fire; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 4d6 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee horns (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 piercing; breath weapon 30-foot cone, 6d10 fire. Green swim Speed 40 feet, ignores difficult terrain from non-magical foliage; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 poison; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee horns (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 piercing; breath weapon 30-foot cone, 10d6 poison (Fortitude save instead of Reflex). Red ignore concealed from smoke; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 fire; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 4d6 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; Melee wing (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d8 bludgeoning; breath weapon 30-foot cone, 10d6 fire. Silver cloud walk; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 2d12 piercing plus 2d6 cold; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damage 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; breath weapon 30-foot cone, 8d8 cold. White climb Speed 25 feet on ice only; Melee jawsvar_noreachnotraits, Damage 3d6 piercing plus 2d6 cold; Melee claw (agilevar_noreachwithtraits), Damag+NN5e 3d10 slashing; Melee tail (reach var_reach10 feet), Damage 3d10 bludgeoning; breath weapon 30-foot cone, 10d6 cold.

hints.desc:
The copper dragon's climb speed applies on stone only.

The green dragon ignores difficult terrain from non-magical foliage.

The silver dragon can cloud walk.

The white dragon's climb speed applies on ice only.
The red dragon ignores concealed from smoke.
You have hands in this battle form and can take manipulate actions.

descs.value: You gain a +14 status bonus to breath weapon damage.

name: Divine Wrath (Caster)
desc: You can channel the fury of your deity against foes of opposed alignment. You deal damage of the alignment you chose, and each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Creatures that match the alignment you chose are unaffected. Those that neither match nor oppose it treat the result of their saving throw as one degree better. Critical Success The creature is unaffected. Success The creature takes half damage. Failure The creature takes full damage and is sickened 1. Critical Failure The creature takes full damage and is sickened 2; while it is sickened, it is also slowed 1.

name: Energy Absorption
desc: You gain resistance <var>var1</var> to acid, cold, electricity, or fire damage from the triggering effect (one type of your choice). The resistance applies only to the triggering effect's initial damage.

name: Enlarge
desc:
Bolstered by magical power, you grow to size Large. Your equipment grows with you but returns to natural size if removed. You are clumsy 1. Your reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if you started out Tiny), and you gain a +2 status bonus to melee damage.

At 4th Level, you instead grow to size Huge. The status bonus to melee damage is +4 and your reach increases by 10 feet (or 15 feet if you started out Tiny).

At 6th Level, the caster chooses either the 2nd-level or 4th-level version of this spell.

name: False Vision
desc: You have created a false image that fools any attempts to scry on an area. Any scrying spell sees, hears, smells, and otherwise detects whatever you wish within the area, rather than what is actually in the area. You can Sustain the Spell each round to change the illusion as you desire, including playing out a complex scene. If the scrying spell is of a higher level than false vision, the scryer can attempt a Perception check to disbelieve the illusion, though even if they're successful, they can't learn what's truly going on in the area.

name: Fatal Aria Immunity
desc: You cannot be affected by Fatal Aria for the duration.

name: Favorable Review (Critical Failures)
desc:
You have enchanted a creature to ensure they have only good things to say about your show, specifically about a single creature, location, or performance, such as "Dame Ellendia," "Savories Meats," or "the Theater of the Mind's latest magic show."

Every target that has critically failed its will save cannot speak unfavorably about the subject, and genuinely holds a favorable opinion about the subject, with their attitude toward the creature (or creatures associated with the subject, such as the owner of a location or artists in a performance) becoming two degrees better (for example, helpful instead of indifferent)

name: Favorable Review (Failures)
desc:
You have enchanted a creature to ensure they have only good things to say about your show, specifically about a single creature, location, or performance, such as "Dame Ellendia," "Savories Meats," or "the Theater of the Mind's latest magic show."

Every target that has failed its will save cannot speak unfavorably about the subject for the duration. This doesn't change the target's opinion about the subject, but the target's attempts to speak ill of the subject - whether in speech, writing, or other communication - always twist into compliments and praise instead. The target likely becomes aware of this effect quickly and can avoid speaking about the subject entirely if they choose.

name: Fear
desc: The caster has planted fear in you, with effects depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You are frightened 1. Failure You are frightened 2. Critical Failure You are frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

name: Fear (Caster)
desc: You have planted fear in the targets; each target is affected depending on its Will save. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target is frightened 1. Failure The target is frightened 2. Critical Failure The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

name: Fearful Feast
desc: After you have become frightened, the caster has drawn in the bravery, self-confidence, and hope to which you cling and then stripped away your false assumption that these fragile emotions can save you from the oblivion of terror. You take mental damage and additional effects according to your Will saving throw. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success Your frightened condition increases by 1, and you take half damage. Failure Your frightened condition increases by 2, and you take full damage. Critical Failure Your frightened condition increases by 3, and you take double damage.

name: Feast of Ashes
desc: You are cursed with a hunger no food can sate. The effect depends on your Fortitude save. Critical Success You are unaffected and are temporarily immune for 1 hour. Success You are fatigued for 1 round. Failure You are afflicted by hunger as if you hadn't eaten food in days. You are fatigued and take |dice=var1| var1 damage each day that can't be healed until you sate your hunger. No amount of eating can sate your hunger during the spell's duration. After the spell's duration, you take damage from starvation. Critical Failure As failure but you take |dice=var2| var2 damage each day, twice as much as usual for hunger.
inputRequired:
On a failure, take 1d4 damage plus 1d4 damage per spell level above 2nd each day. After the spell's duration, take damage from starvation.

On a critical failure, take 2d4 damage plus 2d4 damage per spell level above 2nd each day. After the spell's duration, take damage from starvation.

hints.desc: The damage you take from Feast of Ashes can't be healed until you sate your hunger. No amount of eating can sate your hunger during the spell's duration. After the spell's duration, you take damage from starvation.

name: Feast of Ashes (Caster)
desc: You have cursed the target with a hunger no food can sate, depending on its Fortitude save. You can Dismiss the spell. Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune for 1 hour. Success The creature is fatigued for 1 round. Failure The creature is immediately afflicted by hunger as if it hadn't eaten food in days. It becomes fatigued and takes |dice=var1| var1 damage each day that can't be healed until it sates its hunger. No amount of eating can sate the creature's hunger during the spell's duration. After the spell's duration, the creature takes damage from starvation. Critical Failure As failure but the creature takes |dice=var2| var2 damage each day, twice as much as usual for hunger.

name: Feast of Ashes Immunity
desc: You cannot be cursed by the feast of ashes spell for the duration.

name: Feather Fall
desc: Your fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If you reach the ground while the spell is in effect, you take no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as you land.
inputRequired: Remove the condition as soon as you land.

hints.desc: Your fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If you reach the ground while the spell is in effect, you take no damage from the fall.

name: Feather Fall (Caster)
desc: You cause the air itself to arrest a fall. The target's fall slows to 60 feet per round, and the portion of the fall during the spell's duration doesn't count when calculating falling damage. If the target reaches the ground while the spell is in effect, it takes no damage from the fall. The spell ends as soon as the target lands.
inputRequired: Remove the condition as soon as the target lands.

name: Feet to Fins
desc: Your feet have transformed into fins, improving mobility in the water but reducing it on land. You gain a swim Speed equal to your normal land Speed, but your land Speed becomes 5 feet.

hints.desc: Your land speed is reduced to 5 feet. For the purpose of calculating your swim speed, this is not directly applied.

name: Feet to Fins (Caster)
desc: The target's feet have transformed into fins, improving mobility in the water but reducing it on land. The target gains a swim Speed equal to its normal land Speed, but its land Speed becomes 5 feet.

name: Fey Disappearance
desc: You become invisible and ignore natural difficult terrain (such as underbrush). <var>var1</var>

hints.desc: You ignore natural difficult terrain (such as underbrush).

descs.value: Any hostile action you use ends this invisibility, but you still ignore natural difficult terrain.
If you use a hostile action, the invisibility doesn't end.

name: Fey Glamour
desc: (Fey Glamour adds Veil at one level lower, or does nothing if Illusory Scene was chosen, then ends immediately. It cannot be added manually.)

name: Fey Glamour (Caster)
desc: Calling upon fey glamours, you have cloaked an area or the targets in illusion. This has the effect of either illusory scene on the area or veil on the creatures, as if heightened to a level 1 level lower than fey glamour, using fey glamour's range and duration.

name: False Life
desc: You create a reservoir of vitality from necromantic energy, gaining a number of temporary Hit Points equal to <var>var1</var> plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

name: Fallow Field Immunity
desc: Your healing cannot be prevented by the fallow field spell for the duration.

name: Fallow Field (Caster)
desc: A sickly yellow light fills the area as entropic forces prevent healing. When a creature within the area would regain Hit Points, such as from a healing effect or an ability like fast healing or regeneration, it must attempt a Will save. Critical Success The creature regains the full number of Hit Points that would be restored by the healing effect, and is temporarily immune for 1 minute. Success The creature regains the full number of Hit Points that would be restored. Failure The creature regains only half the number of Hit Points that would be restored. Critical Failure The creature does not regain Hit Points from the healing effect.

name: Fallow Field
desc: A sickly yellow light fills the area as entropic forces prevent healing. As you would regain Hit Points, such as from a healing effect or an ability like fast healing or regeneration, it is prevented depending on your Will save. Critical Success You regain the full number of Hit Points that would be restored by the healing effect, and are temporarily immune for 1 minute. Success You regain the full number of Hit Points that would be restored. Failure You regain only half the number of Hit Points that would be restored. Critical Failure You do not regain Hit Points from the healing effect.
inputRequired: If you regain Hit Points from fast healing while in the spell area, take the appropriate amount of damage to reduce the healing afterwards.

name: Enlarge (Caster)
desc:
Bolstered by magical power, the target grows to size Large. Its equipment grows with it but returns to natural size if removed. The creature is clumsy 1. Its reach increases by 5 feet (or by 10 feet if it started out Tiny), and it gains a +2 status bonus to melee damage. This spell has no effect on a Large or larger creature.

At 4th Level, the target instead grows to size Huge. The status bonus to melee damage is +4 and the creature's reach increases by 10 feet (or 15 feet if the creature started out Tiny). The spell has no effect on a Huge or larger creature.

At 6th Level, you can choose either the 2nd-level or 4th-level version of this spell and apply its effects to 10 willing creatures.

name: Entangle
desc: You take a -10-foot circumstance penalty to your Speeds until you leave the entangled area. You can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove this effect.
inputRequired: Remove the condition if you leave the entangled area or if you successfully Escape.

name: Entangle (Caster)
desc: Plants in the target area entangle creatures. The area counts as difficult terrain. Each round that a creature starts its turn in the area, it must attempt a Reflex save. On a failure, it takes a -10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it leaves the area, and on a critical failure, it is also immobilized for 1 round. Creatures can attempt to Escape at entangle's DC to remove these effects.

name: Enthrall
desc: You are fascinated by the caster's words, depending on your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected and notice that the caster tried to use magic. Success You don't need to pay attention, but don't notice the caster tried to use magic (you might notice others are enthralled). Failure You are fascinated with the caster. You can attempt another Will save if you witness actions or speech with which you disagree. If you succeed, you're no longer fascinated and are temporarily immune for 1 hour. If you are subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against you, the fascination ends immediately. Critical Failure As failure, but you can't attempt a save to end the fascination if you disagree with the caster.

name: Enthrall (Caster)
desc: Your words fascinate your targets. You speak or sing without interruption throughout the casting and duration. Targets who notice your speech or song might give their undivided attention; each target must attempt a Will save. The GM might grant a circumstance bonus (to a maximum of +4) if the target is of an opposing religion, ancestry, or political leaning, or is otherwise unlikely to agree with what you're saying. Each creature that comes within range has to attempt a save when you Sustain the Spell. Critical Success The target is unaffected and notices that you tried to use magic. Success The target needn't pay attention but doesn't notice you tried to use magic (it might notice others are enthralled). Failure The target is fascinated with you. It can attempt another Will save if it witnesses actions or speech with which it disagrees. If it succeeds, it's no longer fascinated and is temporarily immune for 1 hour. If the target is subject to a hostile act, or if another creature succeeds at a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against it, the fascination ends immediately. Critical Failure As failure, but the target can't attempt a save to end the fascination if it disagrees with you.

name: Enthrall Immunity
desc: You cannot be affected by the enthrall spell.

name: Ephemeral Hazards
desc: You have touched an illusory hazard or occupied one's space at the start of your turn. You take mental damage and might have difficulty moving through the area depending on your Will save. A creature can take this damage only once per turn, even if it moves through several hazards. Critical Success You are unaffected by the hazards and no longer need to attempt Will saves against them. Success You realize the hazards aren't real but still take half damage from them; on future Will saves against the hazard, you continue to use this result unless you roll a critical success. Failure You take full damage and treat the square as difficult terrain. Critical Failure You take double damage and cannot pass through a square containing a hazard.

hints.desc: You treat the square containing the illusory hazard as difficult terrain.
You cannot pass through a square containing an illusory hazard.

name: Ephemeral Hazards (Caster)
desc: You have created illusory hazards, such as spinning blades or a puddle of acid, in four 10-foot-by-10-foot spaces within range. The hazards are merely a mental projection, and a creature receives a Will save each time it touches a hazard or is occupying one's space at the start of its turn. Depending on the result, the creature takes |dice=var1 Mental| var1 mental damage and might have difficulty moving through the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn, even if it moves through several hazards. Choose bludgeoning, slashing, piercing, acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage when you cast ephemeral hazards; resistances and weaknesses to those damage types apply if the target thinks they do, as judged by the GM. You can freely choose the appearance and damage type of each hazard as long as its appearance reflects the type of damage it deals (for instance, a hazard that deals piercing damage might take the form of sharpened spikes). Critical Success The creature is unaffected by the hazards and no longer needs to attempt Will saves against them. Success The creature realizes the hazards aren't real but still takes half damage from them; on future Will saves against the hazards, the creature continues to use this result unless it rolls a critical success. Failure The target takes full damage and treats the square as difficult terrain. Critical Failure The target takes double damage and cannot pass through a square containing a hazard.

name: Enhance Victuals
desc:
You have transformed the targeted water or food into delicious fare, changing water into wine or another fine beverage or enhancing the food's taste and ingredients to make it a gourmet treat.

The food turns back to normal if not consumed before the duration expires, though any poisons that were counteracted are still gone.

name: Ethereal Jaunt
desc:
You travel to the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the Material Plane. Material Plane creatures can't see you, and you can move through things on the Material Plane. You move at half your normal Speeds, but can move in any direction (including up and down).

You can see onto the Material Plane within a radius of 60 feet; it is gray, hazy, and concealed from you. You can't affect the Material Plane, and you can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there.

When the spell ends, you return to the Material Plane. If you're in the air, you fall (unless you can fly), and if you're inside an object, you're pushed into the nearest open space and take |dice=1d6| 1d6 damage per 5 feet you were pushed.

If you cast this spell when not on the Material Plane, it is lost.

hints.desc: Material Plane creatures can't see you, and you can move through things on the Material Plane. You move at half your normal Speeds, but can move in any direction (including up and down).

Material Plane creatures can't see you, and you can see onto the Material Plane within a radius of 60 feet; it is gray, hazy, and concealed from you. You can't affect the Material Plane, and you can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there.
You can't affect the Material Plane, and you can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there.

descs.value: You can target up to five additional willing creatures at a range of 30 feet. The duration is up to 10 minutes.

name: Exchange Image (Caster)
desc: You have traded appearances with the target, with the effects depending on the result of the target's Will saving throw. Willing and unconscious targets automatically critically fail this saving throw. Critical Success No effect. Success You take on the target's appearance, and they take yours. This has the same effects as a 1st-level illusory disguise spell, except that the target can't Dismiss the disguise. The duration is 1 minute or until Dismissed. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 hour or until Dismissed. Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 24 hours.

name: Extend Spell
desc: Calling upon your blood's knowledge of the ancients, you extend your magic. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a duration of 1 minute and a single target, the spell instead lasts 10 minutes. You can extend a spell only if you cast it from a spell slot lower than your highest spell slot, and you can have only one active spell at a time extended in this way.
inputRequired: The next spell you cast with a duration will last for 10 minutes, unless its duration is longer.

name: Face in the Crowd
desc: While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, your appearance has become bland and nondescript. You gain a +2 status bonus to Deception and Stealth checks to go unnoticed among the crowd, and you ignore difficult terrain caused by the crowd.

hints.desc: You gain a +2 status bonus to Deception and Stealth checks to go unnoticed among the crowd.
You ignore difficult terrain caused by the crowd.

name: Face in the Crowd (Caster)
desc: While in a crowd of roughly similar creatures, each target's appearance has become bland and nondescript. They gain a +2 status bonus to Deception and Stealth checks to go unnoticed among the crowd, and they ignore difficult terrain caused by the crowd.

name: Faerie Dust
desc: Magical dust is making you easier to trick, depending on your Will save. Success You are unaffected. Failure You can't use reactions and take a -2 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves. Critical Failure As failure, and you also take a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.

hints.desc: You can't use reactions unless you succeeded in your initial Will save.

name: Faerie Dust (Caster)
desc: You have sprinkled magical dust in the spell's area, making those within easier to trick, depending on their will save: Success The creature is unaffected. Failure The creature can't use reactions and takes a -2 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves. Critical Failure As failure, and the creature also takes a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.

name: Faerie Dust (Critical Failure Stage 2)
desc: Magical dust is making you easier to trick. You take a -1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for the rest of the duration.

name: Faerie Fire
desc: All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be concealed while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are invisible, they are concealed while affected by faerie fire, rather than being undetected.

name: Exchange Image
desc: The caster has traded appearances with you, with the effects depending on the result of your Will saving throw. Willing and unconscious targets automatically critically fail this saving throw. Critical Success No effect. Success The caster takes on your appearance, and you take theirs. This has the same effects as a 1st-level illusory disguise spell, except that you can't Dismiss the disguise. The duration is 1 minute or until Dismissed by the caster. Failure As success, but the duration is 1 hour or until Dismissed by the caster. Critical Failure As success, but the duration is 24 hours.

name: Zone of Truth (Caster)
desc: You have designated an area in which creatures are compelled to speak only truth. Creatures within or entering the area have difficulty lying. Each potentially affected creature must attempt a Will save when the spell is cast or when the creature first enters the area. It uses the results of this initial save if it leaves and reenters the area. Affected creatures are aware of this enchantment; therefore, they can avoid answering questions to which they would normally respond with a lie, or they can be evasive as long as they remain within the boundaries of the truth. Critical Success The target is unaffected. Success The target takes a -2 status penalty to Deception checks. Failure The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies, and it takes a -2 status penalty to Deception checks. Critical Failure The target can't speak any deliberate and intentional lies and takes a -4 status penalty to Deception checks.
